content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is an implementation of the `keep_only_names` function in Julia:
```julia
function keep_only_names(words::AbstractString[]))
    filtered_words = words.filter(|word| word.start_with(capital_letter))))
    return filtered_words
end

# Example usage
words = ["dog", "cat", "bird", "fish", "elephant", "giraffe", "hippopotamus", "jaguar", "kangaroo", "leopard", "mountain lion", "newt", "octopus", "panda", "python", "rhinoceros"] 

filtered_words = keep_only_names(words)

println(filtered_words)
```

This implementation defines a function called `keep_only_names` that takes an array of strings (`words`)) as input and returns an array of strings that only contains words that start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog"))
